page.title: 18Wildlife in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: Foxes thrive in the forestry areas and are hunted regularly, on foot with hounds and shotguns. Badgers seem to be surviving in several sets and can sometimes be seen alongside the road at night. Grey squirrels are treated as pests in the forests. Rabbits are starting to make a come back from myxomatosis but outbreaks still occur from time to time. Hares are very common and their tracks are particularly easy to see in the snow. There are many small rodents such as bank voles and shrews. The birdlife varies from buzzards, kestrels, many crows and magpies, wood pigeons to thew smaller birds, tits, goldcrests and robins etc. Migrant visitors include swifts, swallows, house martins, cuckoos, various warblers and in winter large flocks of starlings and redwings.
